item.title: Hundreds march to White House to protest Trump's D.C. crackdown
item.description: Protesters marched to the White House on Saturday as D.C. Metropolitan Police officers and National Park Service police looked on from a distance.

item.title: State Department halts 'medical-humanitarian' visas for people from Gaza
item.description: The U.S. State Department says it's halting visas for visitors from Gaza as it reviews its process for granting visas for medical evacuees.

item.title: Immigration arrests dip in July, and activists hope they're partly responsible
item.description: Immigration arrests falter in July after a big push for mass deportations in June. Activists in sanctuary jurisdictions hope their resistance plays a role.

item.title: Government forces Air Canada flight attendants back to work, into arbitration
item.description: Canada's government forced Air Canada and its striking flight attendants back to work and into arbitration Saturday after a work stoppage stranded more than 100,000 travelers around the world.

item.title: Old Fiddler's Convention is pushing 90 and keeping mountain music alive
item.description: The Old Fiddler's Convention in Galax, Va., features mostly amateur musicians playing Bluegrass and Old Time music. At age 89, it's the oldest continuous competition of its kind in the U.S.
